description: Triangle defined by a(n+1,k)=a(n,k-1)+a(n-1,k), a(n,1)=1, a(1,k)=1, a(2,k)=min(2,k).
links: D. J. Broadhurst, On the enumeration of irreducible k-fold Euler sums and their roles in knot theory and field theory
mathematica: a[n_, k_] := a[n, k] = a[n-1, k-1] + a[n-2, k]; a[n_, 1] = 1; a[1, k_] = 1; a[2, k_] := Min[2, k]; Table[a[n, k], {n, 1, 10}, {k, 1, n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Feb 26 2013 *)
crossrefs: Essentially a reflected version of A055801.
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, _David Broadhurst_
extensions: Entry improved by comments from Michael Somos
